pr_title: [BEAM-10475] Add a well-known coder for ShardedKey in Java/Python SDK

timeline.message: Add a well-known ShardedKey coder in Java SDK

timeline.bodyText: Currently the shard id is encoded using a ByteArrayCoder which uses a VarInt coder to encode/decode the length in 32bits. That is consistent with the parsing logic in the unified worker. But in Python we seem to be using 64bits  (e.g., VarIntCoder). Should I make it consistent by explicitly encoding / decoding a long value here?
timeline.author: nehsyc

replies.bodyText:
The coder specification is underspecified as to how large the var int can be:

  
    
      beam/model/pipeline/src/main/proto/beam_runner_api.proto
    
    
         Line 673
      in
      eb75286
    
    
    
    

        
          
           BYTES = 0 [(beam_urn) = "beam:coder:bytes:v1"]; 
        
    
  


Java can't support byte[] greater then 2^31-1 in size. Also note that a varint64 coder and varint32 coder share the same encoding for all values from [0, 2^31-1] so this is unlikely to become an issue for shard id encoding so can you can ignore this for now.
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: The two encodings are the same for all values in the range we'll be dealing with (and neither Java nor GRPC can handle >4G sized byte arrays) so we should be fine here.
replies.author: robertwb

timeline.bodyText:
I thought we were going to use the empty byte array as the default and not differentiate null.
It will remove an if from encode/decode logic and also save one byte in the encoded representation.
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: Please also implement structuralValue, verifyDeterministic, consistentWithEquals, isRegisterByteSizeObserverCheap.
timeline.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: Done. Did not use the StructuralByteArray for shard id. Seems fine since AutoValue does compare values of bytes array as opposed to object identity.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.bodyText: This is already implemented in StructuredCoder.java, no point in duplicating.
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: Can you remove the irrelevant whitespace changes?
timeline.author: robertwb

timeline.bodyText: There seems to be lots of whitespace changes in this file (and elsewhere).
timeline.author: robertwb

replies.bodyText: Oops. Happened to apply IntelliJ's auto format. Reverted.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.bodyText: Are we leveraging AutoValue for hash and equality? If so, I don't think that'll work with byte[] here.
timeline.author: robertwb

replies.bodyText: Yes. AutoValue seems to be doing a reasonable job for byte[]. It uses Arrays.hashCode and Arrays.equals for has and equality.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.bodyText: We shouldn't add this, it should be copied on demand. Otherwise things may diverge which defeats the purpose of standard coders.
timeline.author: robertwb

replies.bodyText: Added a string type and a tuple type.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.bodyText: You can drop the anding with 0xFFFF. You could also just return hash((self.key, self.shard_key)) (i.e. has the tuple).
timeline.author: robertwb

@@ -0,0 +1,65 @@
+#
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more

+
+# pytype: skip-file
+
+from __future__ import absolute_import
+
+
+class ShardedKey(object):
+  """A sharded key consisting of a user key and a shard id.
+
+  Attributes:
+    key: The user key.
+    shard_id: An opaque byte string that uniquely represents a shard of the key.
+  """
+  def __init__(
+      self,
+      key,
+      shard_id=b'',  # type: bytes
+  ):
+    # type: (...) -> None
+    assert shard_id is not None
+    self._key = key
+    self._shard_id = shard_id
+
+  @property
+  def key(self):
+    return self._key
+
+  @property
+  def shard_id(self):
+    return self._shard_id
+
+  def __repr__(self):
+    return '(%s, %s)' % (repr(self.key), self.shard_id)
+
+  def __eq__(self, other):
+    return (
+        type(self) == type(other) and self.key == other.key and
+        self.shard_id == other.shard_id)
+
+  def __ne__(self, other):
+    # TODO(BEAM-5949): Needed for Python 2 compatibility.
+    return not self == other
+
+  def __hash__(self):
+    return ((hash(self.key) & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF) + 3 *

timeline.bodyText: Do we intend this to be public? IMHO, it'd be better to not have it part of the public API (and we can always add it later if needed).

replies.bodyText: At least the coder impl needs to access the shard id for encoding. In Java, the coder is defined inside of the ShardedKey class so we could make the shard id protected (not private for the AutoValue to work). But in Python the coder is defined separately.
replies.author: nehsyc

replies.bodyText: We can simply access _shard_id directly from the coder and get rid of this "public" accessor.
replies.author: robertwb

timeline.bodyText:
Instead of referencing varInt(len(shard id)) shard id we should just say that the shard id is encoded using beam:coder:bytes:v1
Other coders descriptions should be more like row where we refer to other well known encodings.
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: In the long run we should aim to replace the existing implementation and its usage within WriteFiles.
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: Please make byte[0] a constant. Please add comment saying that the default shard identifier is the empty byte string.
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: Why do you need the LengthPrefixCoderImpl here?
timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1365,3 +1366,38 @@ def estimate_size(self, value, nested=False):
     # type: (Any, bool) -> int
     value_size = self._value_coder.estimate_size(value)
     return get_varint_size(value_size) + value_size
+
+
+class ShardedKeyCoderImpl(StreamCoderImpl):
+  """For internal use only; no backwards-compatibility guarantees.
+
+  A coder for sharded user keys.
+
+  The encoding and decoding should follow the order:
+      length of shard id byte string
+      shard id byte string
+      encoded user key
+  """
+  def __init__(self, key_coder_impl):
+    self._shard_id_coder_impl = LengthPrefixCoderImpl(BytesCoderImpl())

replies.bodyText: BytesCoder simply copies the value to the stream and it doesn't automatically prepend a length prefix (code). While in Java the ByteArrayCoder does prepend the length.
replies.author: nehsyc

replies.bodyText:
I was under the impression that nested=True would have the BytesCoderImpl have the length written by the OutputStream:

  
    
      beam/sdks/python/apache_beam/coders/slow_stream.py
    
    
         Line 45
      in
      c921b0c
    
    
    
    

        
          
           self.write_var_int64(len(b))
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: I see. It requires a nested context which is always true for shard id. The StreamCoderImpl that the ShardedKeyImpl inherits seems to always use an unnested context so the encoded key won't have a length prefix if it is a string or bytes. Should I make the ShardedKeyImpl inherit CoderImpl directly to allow different encoding for different context? Also I am confused by the Java documentation for encoding/decoding context in Coder - seems like it's preferred to have a default context, either nested or unnested but not both.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                self._key_coder_impl.encode_to_stream(value.key, out, True)
          
          
            
                self._key_coder_impl.encode_to_stream(value.key, out, nested)

+    self._key_coder_impl.encode_to_stream(value.key, out, True)

replies.bodyText: Didn't change this in the latest commit since it would by default apply an unnested context which doesn't seem to be consistent with the Java encoding. Please see my other comment above.
replies.author: nehsyc

replies.bodyText: True is correct and matches the description and Java. Let's not create more coders that have different nested/unnested encodings.
replies.author: robertwb

timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1365,3 +1366,38 @@ def estimate_size(self, value, nested=False):
     # type: (Any, bool) -> int
     value_size = self._value_coder.estimate_size(value)
     return get_varint_size(value_size) + value_size
+
+
+class ShardedKeyCoderImpl(StreamCoderImpl):
+  """For internal use only; no backwards-compatibility guarantees.
+
+  A coder for sharded user keys.
+
+  The encoding and decoding should follow the order:
+      length of shard id byte string
+      shard id byte string
+      encoded user key
+  """
+  def __init__(self, key_coder_impl):
+    self._shard_id_coder_impl = LengthPrefixCoderImpl(BytesCoderImpl())
+    self._key_coder_impl = key_coder_impl
+
+  def encode_to_stream(self, value, out, nested):
+    # type: (ShardedKey, create_OutputStream, bool) -> None
+    self._shard_id_coder_impl.encode_to_stream(value.shard_id, out, True)
+    self._key_coder_impl.encode_to_stream(value.key, out, True)
+
+  def decode_from_stream(self, in_stream, nested):
+    # type: (create_InputStream, bool) -> ShardedKey
+    shard_id = self._shard_id_coder_impl.decode_from_stream(in_stream, True)
+    key = self._key_coder_impl.decode_from_stream(in_stream, True)
+    return ShardedKey(key=key, shard_id=shard_id)
+
+  def estimate_size(self, value, nested=False):
+    # type: (Any, bool) -> int
+    estimated_size = 0
+    estimated_size += (
+        self._shard_id_coder_impl.estimate_size(value.shard_id, nested=True))
+    estimated_size += (
+        self._key_coder_impl.estimate_size(value.key, nested=True))
